result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Clayton Mark Hinderscheid

records.addlTxt: filed by DA's Office, on behalf of VW Office. bph
Per judge's order. Faxed: SCSO, Dispatch, Jail. jaf

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to call Justice Support Center at least ONE times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

1:28 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: C. Dillon, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Clayton Mark Hinderscheid in court, in custody.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Clayton Mark Hinderscheid.  Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin.  DE does qualify for PD.  DE confirms PO box for mailing purposes. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG. Bond argument.  Court orders bond.  Court QUASHES warrant.  Adjourned at 1:32 PM. bph
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for December 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
